subject: World Cup (Skiing)
Skiing
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn managed to expand her lead in the overall World Cup standings on Sunday despite finishing 10th in a giant slalom that was won by Kathrin Zettel in an Austrian sweep in Cortina d’Ampezzo, Italy. With Maria Riesch skiing out in the first run and Anja Paerson placing 18th after nearly veering off course a few gates from the finish, Vonn gained points on both in the overall standings. Vonn leads with 882 points, followed by Riesch (810) and Paerson (775).
